author: Staff Reporter
text:
Dr. N.G.P. Arts and Science College turned out to be the place in Coimbatore on Friday where young minds from schools battled hard to win Brain Beats 2016 quiz contest. The college had organised the State-level contest for students of classes eight, nine, 10, Plus One and Plus Two.

More than 200 students from 25 schools had participated in the contest in the first round. The organisers had chosen eight teams of two students each for the final round. Standing between those students and prizes was quiz master Professor M. Rangarajan.

At the end of six rounds of questions from various fields, the organisers declared M. Sharat Chandar and D. Sathyanarayanan of GKD Mat. Hr. Sec. School, Periyanaickenpalayam, the winners. The organisers gave Rs. 10,000 in prize along with certificates and trophies. S. Bragadeeswaran and A.S. Hari Krishna, also from the same school won the second prize that included Rs. 7,000, certificates and trophies. Chinmaya International Residential School students S. Sanjay and S. Pragadeeshwaran secured the third place to win Rs. 5,000, certificates and trophies.

The organisers also gave Rs. 1,000 each as consolation prize to the remaining five teams that were part of the finals.

Thavamani D. Palaniswami, Secretary of the college, gave away the prizes in the presence of Nalla G. Palaniswami, Chairman, Kovai Medical Center Research and Educational Trust, P.R. Muthuswamy, Principal, and others. The Hindu In School was the media partner for the event.
title: School students show their best at quiz contest
